New Records: South Africa handed New Zealand their second heaviest defeat in World Cup history.
Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock scored a century with 114 runs.
Rassie van der Dussen scored a century with 133 runs.
South Africa scored 357-4 in their innings.
New Zealand were all out for 167.
Gerald Coetzee took the final wicket, dismissing Glenn Phillips for 60.
Keshav Maharaj took multiple key wickets, including Boult, Neesham, and Santner.
Marco Jansen took the wickets of Conway and Ravindra early in New Zealand's innings.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and chose to bowl first.
Post-Match Reflections: Quinton de Kock expressed satisfaction with his performance and mentioned his career nearing its end.
De Kock hoped that the score of 357 would be enough to secure a win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch conditions were discussed, with Simon Doull noting the impact of dew around the 25-over mark.
